formal_definition.latex: \text{A functor } F: \mathcal{C} \to \mathcal{D} \text{ consists of:} \\ \text{1. Object map: } F: \text{ob}(\mathcal{C}) \to \text{ob}(\mathcal{D}) \\ \text{2. Morphism map: } F: \text{hom}_{\mathcal{C}}(A,B) \to \text{hom}_{\mathcal{D}}(F(A), F(B)) \\ \text{satisfying:} \\ F(\text{id}_A) = \text{id}_{F(A)} \\ F(g \circ f) = F(g) \circ F(f)
components: Object mapping: F(A) for each object A
Morphism mapping: F(f) for each morphism f

applies.applicationContext: Functors in programming apply the mathematical concept of structure-preserving mappings between categories
